channel.title: Photoshop - Getting around
channel.description:
Photoshop, with it's multitudes of tools can be a little intimidating. With this guide I will be showing you the [i]basics[/i] of this great program
If you want to [i]try[/i] photoshop, a download is available on the [url=http://www.adobe.com]Adobe Website[/url].
[b]First off, I will begin by explaining all the features in the 'tools' window[/b]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/lFhfx.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/tRd8Q.png[/img] - Basic movement tool, used to move layers, etc
[img]http://i.imgur.com/jrCaY.png[/img] - Selection/Marquee tool. Basically allows you to edit only what's inside the selected area. Has the ability to be changed to circular, etc
[img]http://i.imgur.com/HuMoS.png[/img] - Quick Selection tool. It selects an area of the current layer.
[img]http://i.imgur.com/tQFM5.png[/img] - Cropping tool. Need to cut a part of your work off? Use this!
[img]http://i.imgur.com/rETTg.png[/img] - Eyedropper. Used for colour sampling.
[img]http://i.imgur.com/5i2kC.png[/img] - Quite simple, brush tool emulates a paint brush, whilst the pencil emulates a pencil.
[img]http://i.imgur.com/raoAU.png[/img] - Eraser.
[img]http://i.imgur.com/Ao2p0.png[/img] - One of the unique parts of photoshop. Allows you to add a layer where one colour flows to another.
[img]http://i.imgur.com/1An1H.png[/img] - Blur. Something too sharp? Want to create some depth? Here's your tool!
[u][b][size=36pt]Not complete, I just have to go out. Will finish when I get home.[/size][/b][/u]

item.title: Photoshop - Getting around

Good start. Will help me out if I ever get my hands on Photoshop.

item.title: Photoshop - Getting around
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

Photoshop, with it’s multitudes of tools can be a little intimidating. With this guide I will be showing you the basics of this great program

If you want to try photoshop, a download is available on the Adobe Website.

First off, I will begin by explaining all the features in the ‘tools’ window

lFhfx.png41×661

- Basic movement tool, used to move layers, etc

- Selection/Marquee tool. Basically allows you to edit only what’s inside the selected area. Has the ability to be changed to circular, etc

- Quick Selection tool. It selects an area of the current layer.

- Cropping tool. Need to cut a part of your work off? Use this!

- Eyedropper. Used for colour sampling.

- Quite simple, brush tool emulates a paint brush, whilst the pencil emulates a pencil.

- Eraser.

- One of the unique parts of photoshop. Allows you to add a layer where one colour flows to another.

- Blur. Something too sharp? Want to create some depth? Here’s your tool!

[size=36pt]Not complete, I just have to go out. Will finish when I get home.[/size]

Read full topic
